utterance.speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
utterance.content: Customer service. May I help you?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Wrong department, sir.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No, what do you mean, wrong department? I pressed 3 -

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Please hold.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Don’t you put me on hold. I’ve been on hold for 45 min—

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Mm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Your call is very important to us.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Please continue holding.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Hello, hello, hello, hello!

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Sorry about that, sir. I can connect you to the correct department now.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Sir? Are you okay? Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watching you sleep. Is that creepy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mnh-mnh. I think it’s sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I took some pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Less sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re part of a series. Usually you don’t wake up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And now it’s creepy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve been thinking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, relax. I’m over that whole sex-in-zero-g thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good, ‘cause that was just an accident waiting to happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, though. I think it’s time we shake things up. Move to Paris, you know, search for buried treasure in Nepal. We could fly a hot air balloon across the Sahara.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, I love all of those ideas, but I just became captain, and you have your P.I. business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then there’s LokSat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have responsibilities, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what if we didn’t? Hold, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, I might need that. That might be a homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The victim’s not gonna get any deader. Listen. Let’s say we find LokSat and take him down — without getting killed —

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What then? You’re not gonna be captain of the 12th Precinct for very long. You’re on a rocket. Sky’s the limit. So you know what happens then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mnh-mnh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We become normal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle, you’re never gonna be normal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m serious. Think about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will. What do you got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Alan Masters. All signs point to poison — dilated pupils, bluish discoloration around the lips. That’s a giveaway. But I’ll know for sure after the autopsy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who called it in?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Customer service operator for his cable company. She was on the phone with him when it happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What a way to go.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Poisoned, or on the phone with the cable company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least the poison was quick.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like our killer jimmied that window open. Neighbor thought she heard somebody on the fire escape last night around 8:00.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was he poisoned?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: In his water. The filter underneath the kitchen sink was tampered with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ironically, he works for the city as a safety inspector.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm. You know, if I were an expert on character, which I am, I would say that Alan was a bit of a dreamer — — spending his days on the ground inspecting things, but his nights in the clouds, fantasizing of adventure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tragically, his life was cut short before he ever truly lived.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What are you all doing in my apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Um, Lanie…

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t “um, Lanie” me! That man was dead!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He had no pulse, no breath sounds, and his pupils were dilated and fixed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, but he’d been dead less than an hour.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, hey. Is it true that our victim —

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was dead, okay? I know how to do my job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, calm down. It’s all good. I just —

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, no, no. It’s not all good. I almost stuck a thermometer in his liver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, so is he stable?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hm?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: TTX. It’s a neurotoxin found in several species of fish. It’s extremely potent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet he survived, so do you have an explanation?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are a modern-day Lazarus, risen from the grave to answer the eternal question — what’s on the other side?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Who are you again?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ll have to forgive him, Mr. Masters. He’s very excitable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, excuse me if I find pulling back the curtain on what happens when we die just a tad exciting. Was there a white light or is it more of a tunnel thing?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: The last thing I remember, I was taking my pills, trying to get my cable fixed, and then I woke up to an apartment full of police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, no out-of-body experience?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any enemies?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Me? No. I’m an average guy. I go to work, I come home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you dream of so much more, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: How do you know that? Did you read my diary?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I saw your pictures on your — Wait, you keep a diary? As a grown man, call it a journal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about work? Have you upset anyone there recently?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah. There is this guy that works for me — well, used to work for me — Dave Barton. I had to fire him because he was letting serious infractions slide with just a warning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was it for money?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: That was the rumor. And he did seem a little miffed when I let him go. I’ll play you the message that he left me.

utterance.speaker: DAVE BARTON
utterance.content: You slimy little maggot. I’m gonna stab you with a rusty spoon and strangle you with your own intestines. Or better yet, I’m gonna force-feed you your toes one by one, and then I’m gonna light you on fire. First, I’m gonna paralyze you with a claw hammer and then cover you with ants, you son of a *****!

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: And it goes on and on like that for a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you never thought to call the police?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: On Dave? No! He’s just got a big personality.

utterance.speaker: DAVE BARTON
utterance.content: What can I say? I have anger issues.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: And a gift for murderous creativity. Threatening to “nail Alan to the ceiling by his feet and piñata the hell out of his face with a Fungo bat”.

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: It’s all just talk. I actually get nauseous at the sight of blood.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, is that why you decided to poison Alan last night?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: Hey, I was home last night with my wife and my mother-in-law, which, believe you me, is no good for my anger issues. I mean, that woman drives me crazy. Sometimes I just think about getting a blender and a trowel and — Kidding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you better hope your alibi holds up, ‘cause you had all the motive in the world.

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: You want motive? We’re safety inspectors. You think we’re making friends, handing out millions in fines? We’re not getting any Christmas cards. Especially Alan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, especially Alan?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: The guy’s got a rep for being a real stickler. He doesn’t let anything slide.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, is that what you did? Let things slide in exchange for a payday?

utterance.speaker: DAVE
utterance.content: Maybe I did, maybe I didn’t. Doesn’t make me a killer. The point is that Alan refuses to play the game. And that pisses off a lot of people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Did Lanie really declare a live guy dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Well, yeah, but do yourself a favor — don’t mention it to her. So, you got something?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I might have broken open LokSat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You found them?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Unfortunately, no, but I did find someone else. Based on Castle’s discovery of the exact time and date LokSat flew into L.A., I’ve been scrubbing footage from all the Los Angeles area airports. Look who showed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Caleb Brown?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: But he was traveling under an alias — Peter McCaffery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Caleb must have gone to L.A. to meet with LokSat. But who’s driving the SUV?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I don’t know. I can only read part of the plate, but I’m generating a list of possible matches.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain. Dave Barton alibied out, but we’re getting a list of all the companies that Alan has either fined or shut down for violations recently. Then we’re gonna run the list past Alan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose would-be killer is still out there, so what precautions are you taking?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Squad car just brought him home from the hospital. We got a uniform posted outside his door, which makes his only real concern your husband.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you have died and been reborn. What are you gonna do now?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Going to bed. I have a full day of inspections tomorrow. I need to be focused.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can’t just go back to work like nothing happened. You had a near-death experience. That’s a wake-up call. Get out there. Live this life you’ve always dreamed about.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Just because I have a few pictures on my wall doesn’t mean I’m not happy with my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Your drab, solitary life.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: It’s not solitary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So there’s a Ms. Safety Inspector?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Not exactly. But there is a woman I have my eye on. She’s funny and smart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t know you exist?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: All clear. I’ll be right outside if you need anything.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Great, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should really call this woman.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Okay, I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you honestly don’t remember anything about being dead?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Really don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who does that? Who gets a second chance like that and just goes to work the next morning?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: I would. I like work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Alan!

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Someone rigged the bed to electrocute him. Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Sorry, Castle, but this time, he really is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What a waste.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: To be given a second chance and have it taken away like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was just gonna go back to work like nothing happened.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I hadn’t been so focused on his rebirth, I might have noticed that wire. I could have saved him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You can’t beat yourself up, Castle. I was starting to think he was some kind of medical miracle. Turns out, he was just lucky. And in the end, his luck ran out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Forget lucky.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Somebody cooking barbecue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s immortal.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was definitely dead.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was dead the last time, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sorry. Um, can we have a minute, please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m just rattled. You know, people can come back from being poisoned and from being electrocuted, but both in the same day?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, is there an explanation?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I can think of two. Either I’m really bad at my job, or Castle’s right and this guy’s immortal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He is not immortal, and you are a genius at your job. We just got to keep looking for answers, starting with who wants to kill this guy so badly.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Is there any forensics on the second attempt?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. The bed must have been wired after the apartment was already released from being a crime scene, which means the killer had about a two-hour window before Alan and Castle got there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So, the toxin that should have killed Alan, TTX, is a controlled substance, available through only a few pharma supply companies. CDC is sending us over a list right now.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So, finding the buyer might lead to the killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any idea how our boy Alan is still with us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. But Castle has a theory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are a superhero.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No, I’m really not. I’m just an ordinary guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were an ordinary guy, Alan. That’s how most superheroes start out — mild-mannered weaklings, and that’s you!

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Wow, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Relax. It’s all to maximize your transformative arc.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: If I agree with you, will you leave me alone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t be silly. We’re just getting started! First we need to figure out what triggered your transformation, your origin story, if you will.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the origin story is everything! What, there’s, what, nine Spider-Man movies about it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We got a lead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to come up with a superhero name for Alan.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No. No, we really don’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How about…Safety Man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that’s terrible.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, does he have any other powers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. We should really run some tests.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Um, you said something about a lead…?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. Yeah, we’ve been checking into your inspection history to see if there’s somebody you might have pissed off. I think we have a winner — Zantium Labs. You just hit them with a six-figure fine.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re a biopharmaceutical company. I threatened to shut them down after they had a bad chemical spill two days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. A chemical spill? Mystery solved. Exposure to dangerous materials is the most common superhero story there is.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Sorry. The spill was L.A.H. It’s an inorganic compound used as a catalyst to make other chemicals, which — The point is, it can be explosive, but there’s nothing about it that would ever turn anyone into a, I don’t know — Captain Cool?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But keep trying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, who’s on the hook for that spill?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: The lab manager, Frank Patchett. He begged me not to fine him. He said the lab was hemorrhaging money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That sounds like motive. Come on, Castle. Let’s go talk to this guy.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. Maybe I should come with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The girl. The one who doesn’t know you exist. She works there, doesn’t she?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No. Yes. Her name is Gwen. She’s in marketing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sorry, Alan. You’ve got to stay here. If there’s someone at Zantium Labs trying to kill you, I’d be the worst cop on the force if I took you there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Alan. I’ll put in a good word for you with Gwen!

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No, no! Please — Please don’t!

utterance.speaker: GWEN PARKER
utterance.content: I can’t believe someone would try and do that to poor Alan. He’s such a sweet man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you do know him?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Of course. People around here kind of hate him, but, I don’t know, I think he’s really funny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll tell him you said that.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Oh, that’s Frank. Hey, Frank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Patchett, I’m Detective Esposito. I need to ask you a few questions about Alan Masters.

utterance.speaker: FRANK PATCHETT
utterance.content: Is he doing okay? I heard someone tried to kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’s the cleanup going?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Oh, well, we’re almost done here. Accidents happen. Luckily, nobody was hurt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nobody except Alan.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: You think what happened to him is connected to the spill?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe. So why don’t you get changed, and we can go talk about it.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Okay. Locker room’s over there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I’m gonna go take a look around. Origin story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, wow!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Can I help you with something?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, as a matter of fact, you can, uh — Mike. Um, if you had to pick something in this lab that would turn somebody into a superhero, what would it be?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: I’m — I’m sorry. What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Radioactive spider, secret alien technology, super-soldier serum —

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Yeah, we don’t have anything like that here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then what is — What about this? What are you working on right here?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: We’ve discovered an accelerated method for growing hair cells in the mice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Accelerated cell regeneration? That could be the key to immortality.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I’ve been supervising this cleanup for the last 48 hours. Even if I wanted to kill Alan, I didn’t have the opportunity or the energy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But you did have the motive. You begged him not to fine you, and he did anyway.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s a pain in the ass, but the damage was already done. Killing him would have accomplished nothing. You know, something odd did happen when I walked him out to the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Odd how?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: There was someone hanging out at Alan’s car, but he took off when he saw us coming. I didn’t think much of it at the time, but…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does your parking lot have security cameras?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Hume, so you’re an operations manager at a plastics factory that Alan recently shut down. Is that correct?

utterance.speaker: GLEN HUME
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything to Alan. I’m innocent.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Innocent men don’t usually stalk their victims in parking lots.

utterance.speaker: HUME
utterance.content: I just wanted to talk to Alan. That’s all. I needed to find the right moment. We had to be alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. What did you want to talk to him about? Mr. Hume, if all you wanted to do was talk to him, then why did unis find you with two suitcases and a ticket to Mexico?

utterance.speaker: HUME
utterance.content: Because I don’t want to die. They came after Alan and I’m next.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s “they”? If you know who went after Alan, you need to tell us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was it someone from your company?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you a whistle-blower, Glen? Is there something you’re trying to expose? Is that why you wanted to talk to Alan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The NYPD can protect you, and if someone really is trying to kill you, you’re a lot safer in here with us than out there on your own.

utterance.speaker: HUME
utterance.content: Okay. But it’s not someone from my company. It’s the mob.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What would organized crime want with Alan? Waste management.

utterance.speaker: HUME
utterance.content: Yeah. They strong-armed me into giving them the contract for my factory’s hazardous waste disposal. They’ve been doing the same thing all over town. And they just dump the stuff into the landfill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why would they target Alan before you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Alan fired Dave Barton, the only inspector that they could buy. So Alan was becoming a big problem, and their only solution was to kill him.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: The mob is trying to kill me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trying and failing. But do you know why?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Because I’m - I’m, what, Rogaine Man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yuck. Worst name yet. But it does explain why you keep coming back to life. Your cells regenerate at an amazing rate.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Except they don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Just got the test back. No sign of abnormal regenerative activity in blood or tissue cells. In fact, no sign of anything abnormal at all.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Told you. I’m Boring Man. Except for the contract out on my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just to be sure, maybe we should cut off one of his fingers, see if it grows back.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just the tip.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Okay, I’m done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. Where you gonna go?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Home. Or not home. Somewhere safe. Where is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My place. We have yet to unlock the secrets of your powers. Lanie’s a doctor. She can strip you down and check you out.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Forget it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, you owe him!

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No. No, she doesn't! Castle, it's been a long day. I am very overwhelmed. I just want to go back to my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's too bad. You can't. Spidey couldn't go back after the bite. Hulk couldn't go back after the bomb. The Ant-Man couldn't go back after -- I can't remember. Point is, you have an obligation. With great power comes great responsibility. Let's go to my place and get some pizza on the way.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: There's no way I'm going back to your place to eat pizza and explore my superpowers.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Where are we on the waste management company?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's a new entity called Bullseye. We're not sure who's running it, but rumor is it's a new player on the scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Electrocution and poisoning doesn't sound like the mob.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unless they're trying to keep a low profile. The best way to stay off our radar is to fly under it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, true. Why don't you guys head down to the second floor, see if Organized Crime has any insight?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know you can survive poisoning and electrocution. Now it's time to see if you can survive penetrative wounds.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: How about we start with something smaller, like a paper cut?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, this is all a little overwhelming. I understand. All right. Let's -- Let's test for some other powers first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Telekinesis. Try to move the piano with your mind.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Oh. If I try this, will you tell me about Gwen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was a trick. I was actually testing for Spidey-sense.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: I don't have it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clearly.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Can we take a break, please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Ah, no. no. I don't drink.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. You want to know what Gwen said?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yes. Finally.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm telling you with my mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're not getting it?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well, bad news is no telepathy. Good news is I think Gwen is into you. She told me she thinks you're funny.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Really? Funny ha-ha, not funny strange?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. So are you gonna use your double death as a wake-up call and finally ask her out?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What if she says no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if she says yes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is the spirit, Alan.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Well, I didn't think you meant right now!

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Mm! It's ringing. This is very exciting. Oh my God, I'm gonna be sick. I don't know what to say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just be yourself.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Be myself. So, something like, "Hi, this is Alan Masters from the City Department of Safety Inspection, badge number 62475 -- "

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: New plan, new plan. Do not be yourself. Say this --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Hi, Gwen. Hello. This is Alan Masters of -- Yes, that's right. I'm much better, thanks. You? -- Oh, nothing. I was just calling to see if you wanted to have dinner with me. Oh. Okay. I'll see you there. Bye. She said yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well done, Alan! Now all we have to do is plan the perfect date. How much time do we have?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Well, we're meeting at Botticelli's in 30 minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tonight?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: You said yourself it's time to start living.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I just thought it'd be after we apprehended your would-be murderer.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: I know. I will just embrace my powers. Maybe this is my origin story, and my dinner with Gwen will be the beginning of something really terrific!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's the spirit, Alan. And I'm going with you.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Please don't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The first two attempts on your life were meant to be anonymous, quiet. It's very unlikely they'd try something in a public place.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, they did fail twice. They may try to kick it up a notch.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What are you saying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don't order an appetizer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You found something.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Yeah. I ran the partial plate from that SUV Caleb Brown got into, generated a list of names. Guess who's on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brooks. Guy with the bag of spiders who tried to take down Castle and me.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: If Brooks picked up Caleb at the airport, then this ties Caleb directly to LokSat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, look, it's a start, anyway.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: A start? It's photographic evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of what? That he got into a car with a bad guy? Caleb's a public defender. He represents bad guys.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: He was using an alias. We can use this to go at Caleb, get him to reveal LokSat's identity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Until he alerts LokSat that we're onto him, and then we're all dead. No, we gotta wait until we have something more concrete.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Fine. Caleb's alias, Peter McCaffery -- I'll look into it and see what other trips he's taken under that name, see if it leads somewhere more definitive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know this is frustrating. But we're getting close. We just have to tread carefully.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There she is. She looks nice.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: This is a huge mistake. I'm a safety inspector. That's not even a little sexy. This is so much scarier than dying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are Alan Masters, superhero. Chicks dig superheroes.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Should I tell her I'm a superhero?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wouldn't open with that.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Okay. I'm going in. Wish me luck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Hi, Gwen.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Wow, you --

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Good to see you. Oh --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: You look great. Thanks for having dinner with me.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: I was surprised that you called, after the day you've had.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What a day, right? Crazy. Just nuts. I'm -- I -- I -- I'm a superhero.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Nothing. I sneezed.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: You - You sneezed, "I'm a superhero"?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Allergies. Superhero! Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We ID'd the owner of Bullseye Waste Management. He's a guy named Horatio Spate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's a good super villain name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is not a joke. Spate is suspected of executing over a dozen people. I texted you his picture just to put him on your radar. Whatever you do, don't leave the loft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don't leave the loft. Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh --

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crap.

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Hello, Alan.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Do I know you?

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt your romantic dinner.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Seriously? I have an arch-nemesis?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Is that how they dress?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Alan, you're cute, and I like you, but this is all a bit much. You say that you're a superhero, and he's a supervillain. So does that make you his sidekick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sidekick? Please. I'm the mentor.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: And I'm his date. Or at least I was. I'm sorry. This is just weird.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: And she thinks I'm crazy. Thank you so much. This is all your fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it's his. Alan, meet Horatio Spate. He's the new owner of Bullseye Waste Management.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: So, you're the one who's trying to kill me?

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Hardly. If I wanted you dead, you'd be dead already.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Well, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: An arrangement. One that would benefit both of us. Twice someone's tried to kill you, and you're still with us. How long before Lady Luck abandons you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, let me guess. A man like you can offer protection.

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: More than offer. I can guarantee it. In return, all I ask is that you adopt a more laissez-faire interpretation of your inspection policies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a moral test. Every superhero is presented with a moral dilemma trying to corrupt him.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Horatio Spate, my answer is no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gun. Gun.

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Relax, boys. It's gingko. Just started taking it.

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Here's what it does. It improves memory, it sharpens brain function, and it helps a person make really, really good decisions. Perhaps you should try one, and then you can rethink your answer.

utterance.speaker: SPATE
utterance.content: Careful. Dangerous out there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's as if he stepped off the pages of a graphic novel. You should have been there to see him in person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. They should have. Not you, and definitely not Alan. Now, tell me how dangerous it was for you to take him out in public, 'cause I know that you knew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's in love, Beckett. And I love love. -- And I'm sorry and I won't do it again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you won't and you know why? Because I've had him sent to a real safe house until we track down Horatio.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boss, I know we were talking about flying under the radar, but that really doesn't seem to be Horatio's style. I mean, he solves problems with bullets, not poisons and elaborate electrocution traps.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why would he guarantee protection?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, maybe he knows the actual identity of our would-be killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And stopping the hit could benefit his waste disposal company by giving him leverage on Alan. Are any of Horatio's associates recent buyers of TTX? 'Cause that could help us narrow down who's trying to kill Alan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We've got the list right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Lucky Dragon Herbologists? Horatio had a pillbox with a dragon logo on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's it. That's the same logo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It says here that it's a front for the White Lotus Chinese Triad.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so how does an international gang get cleared to possess TTX?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Lucky Dragon is a legitimate business and there are small doses of TTX in Eastern medicine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold up. This doesn't make sense. According to intel, the Triad sees Horatio as a threat to their territory. They're gearing up for war.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, no way is Horatio guaranteeing Alan's safety with the Triads.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless…Horatio said he just started taking ginkgo. What if the two empires are hammering out some kind of an alliance?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: An alliance that Alan unknowingly stumbled onto and put him right in the cross-hairs of the Triad.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But what could bring two warring gangs together to join forces?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, get a search warrant for Lucky Dragon Herbologists and find out.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Caleb. What're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: I hate to bother you, but I could really use your help with a client. Can I borrow you for a quick minute?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, who is this client?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: I think you're familiar with him -- Peter McCaffery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no, it -- it doesn't sound familiar.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: No? Let me fill you in. So, there's this overzealous cop. You know the type. She never knows when to give up. And she has her tech guy look into Peter McCaffery's recent travel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Mr. McCaffery's a very private person, so he set up some unexpected digital trip wires. That's bad news for the tech guy and his boss. And so this cop, she keeps marching toward this kill zone, and unless she makes an about-face, it is not going to end well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't get it. You served a full term in the Pace Corps. You worked for the EPA. You brought legal action against corrupt corporations.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: What's your point, Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened? You used to make a difference. Why did you sell out?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Look. My client is forced to work for a man that he cannot fight. And take my word for it. Neither can you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's help each other out here. We can bring down LokSat. I'm giving you a second chance to make a difference.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Captain, just do yourself a favor, hmm? Heed my warning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you heed mine. You have until 8:00 tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Then what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll expose you. And then we'll both be looking over our shoulders, waiting for LokSat to tie up loose ends. Because once they find out that your cover is blown and I'm onto you, then you're gonna be as dead as I am.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Seven minutes, Kate. Seven minutes. That's how long the brain continues to function after the body dies, and as all of those synapses slowly stop firing off, that's when they say that our lives flash before our eyes. Now, when your seven minutes come, I sincerely hope that you do not flash to this moment, when you had a chance to live, and you chose not to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You want me to handle that? You're on edge this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On edge? Why would I be on edge? Because LokSat's henchman knows we're onto him and assassins could come through the door at any second. I mean, why aren't you on edge?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Caleb is a lot of things, but he's not suicidal, and working with us is his only recourse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He threatened your life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because he was scared. Trust me, Castle, I turned him. I'm positive he's gonna come in today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I think he's coming in, too. Well, either him or LokSat's kill squads.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Geez!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, Judge Kober just denied our search warrant request for the Lucky Dragon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A suspected Triad front. Does she know that we like them for two attempts on Alan's life?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Says we still need probable cause.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we got to go at this a different way. You know, if Horatio and the Triads are working together, this is something big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys. I know how to get in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stick to the plan.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Relax. I totally got this.

utterance.speaker: SHOP MAN
utterance.content: Welcome to Lucky Dragon herbs and remedies. Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Surprise safety inspection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: FYI, sir, he's holding out a badge that says Department of Safety and Health and he's got a serious look on his face.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Very serious look.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Okay. But why two inspectors?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Uh, because he is my trainee…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trainee.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: …and it helps to have a second set of eyes.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Not that one set of eyes or no sets of eyes is a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Bring all the eyes you would like. I'm sure you'll find my medicines violate none of your Western laws.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We'll be the judge of that.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: I ask we stay together so I may address your inspection concerns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. I'll cause a distraction. You slip to the back room.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Here are some of my most precious herbs. Impossible to grow in this country.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you mean these herbs right here?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Your assistant's very clumsy.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yes, he is. Which is why the sooner we get out of your way, the better. Take us to your back room now, please.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: But of course.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Wait. I sense something. Something powerful. An unnatural presence in the order of things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of presence?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: What kind indeed? When is a man not a man? When his life-force cannot be extinguished, when he cannot die. Then he is a god.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think he senses your powers.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah? You do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either that or he's buying time while his guys get the contraband out the back door.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You guys drop the cases.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD. On your knees, fellas.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Heroin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when does heroin look like that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Since it's synthetic heroin, an opioid manufactured to replicate a heroin high. In fact, this stuff actually improves on it because, according to the analysis I ran, it's laced with TTX.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: The same poison that almost killed me? What, heroin isn't dangerous enough?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Because that poison works by blocking synapses. In small doses, it's a powerful analgesic specifically used for the pain of heroin withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it makes the drug more addictive by reducing the painful side effects. So, more addictive heroin that doesn't have to be smuggled into the country because --

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it can be made right here in the good old U. S. of A.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains why the Triads and Horatio are willing to put their differences aside, because --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What does this have to do with me? Why would anybody want me dead?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, clearly this stuff is made in a lab somewhere, and your job is to inspects laboratories, so --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: You know, this shade of yellow looks very familiar. What is it that gives it this color?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: An inorganic catalyst commonly referred to as L.A.H.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Lithium aluminum hydride? That is the same chemical that spilled when I was inspecting Zantium Labs.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: This is why they wanted you dead.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: When the synthetic heroin hits the streets, it'll come out that it was made with L.A.H.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And since you knew the lab had purchased large amounts of L.A.H. --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: They couldn't take the risk that I might see something on the news, put the pieces together, and report it to the authorities.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Which means…

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Someone at Zantium Labs is trying to kill me!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Someone at Zantium Labs is trying to kill you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, gosh, is that what we sound like?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Certainly hope not. I mean, it was cute but just overly cute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alan?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know who ordered the L.A.H. for Zantium?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: I do. Mike Lin, the lead chemist. I remember seeing his name on the purchase order. He's probably the guy who's trying to kill me. He could be very dangerous. We need to get down there and figure something out before he hurts someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We have to be very smart about this. There is no way that Mike, a chemist, would be working alone here, so we have to get a court order to impound the entire laboratory and make sure that nobody destroys any of the evidence.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Well, how long will that take?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don't worry. We'll get this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. There you are. We got the warrant. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Where's Alan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought he was with you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Gwen!

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Alan. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Come with me if you want to live.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Alan, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Mike Lin is secretly making synthetic heroin in the lab. He's the one who's trying to kill me.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Alan, are you sure?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Yeah. But don't worry. The cops are on the way, and until then, I'll protect you.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: This'll work. Yeah, if that old blind guy could use it, so could I.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Or -- or, that's actually better. Wait. Why do you have a gun?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: I'm gonna kill Mike.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. The cops will arrest him.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: That's what I'm afraid of. Mike is the only person here who knows I'm running this drug operation.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: What? Wait, you're the one who poisoned me?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: And electrocuted you, yeah. I was trying to be discreet. I mean, my boyfriend Horatio said I should just shoot you in the head, but --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Hold on! Stop everything! Wha -- Horatio is your boyfriend? So I guess a second date is out of the question?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Aww. Alan. You seriously thought a guy like you had a shot with me?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Ow. I thought dying twice was painful.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Well, maybe it won't be so bad the third time.

utterance.speaker: POLICE
utterance.content: Police! Nobody move! NYPD! Put up your hands! Right now! Get 'em up!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get your hands where we can see 'em!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any sign of Alan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm sure he came here. See if you can find Gwen's office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alan!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is my fault. I forced the superhero mantle onto him. I filled his head with crazy ideas of being invulnerable, and then, like some superhero Icarus, he flew too close to the sun. Alan, I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. I let you down!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Don't mention it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alan! You're alive?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Shhh, not so loud. I've got a splitting headache.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'll, uh, call an ambulance?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Relax, I'm fine. I just need a couple of Advil. What? What is it, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You --

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Did I get shot in the head?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right in the middle! I mean, how did you even -- Wait, that means you've seen your killer. Who - Who was it?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: You're never gonna guess.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Took her down just before she put a bullet in Mike the chemist.

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Why the hell won't you die?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I never thought she was right for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coolest thing ever.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I realize it was only a 22-caliber revolver, but it was fired at point-blank range.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Hey, you sound a little upset that I'm still alive.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, it's just -- Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't suppose you have an explanation this time.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Welcome to the club.

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: Thanks, Doc.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How're you feeling?

utterance.speaker: ALAN
utterance.content: You know, I'm grateful. Especially for the new friend I made. I sure hope we could stay in touch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? You and me? This is the start of a beautiful --

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is what I've been saying all along.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But perhaps discovery of those abilities is best left to a medical expert.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Buh-bye, Castle. Get to stepping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, yeah, thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was Vikram. The DEA just arrested Horatio and a few members of the Triad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Caleb's deadline has come and gone and Vikram said that he's disappeared. He's gone off-grid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's running. Too scared to face LokSat, too scared to work with us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we just lost our only lead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do we do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Maybe you're right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So long as I'm with you, I'll go anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Don't shoot me. I might spill my Scotch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you mean my Scotch. And my most expensive Scotch.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: It's worth it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You had a change of heart, Caleb?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: You know, every morning we wake up and we choose who we want to be. I wake up and I ask myself, "Why are you choosing this?" Because you're right, Kate. I was a good guy once.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you still can be. Who is LokSat?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. You work for him.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Yes. But I started out working for his partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Senator William Bracken?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what, LokSat inherited you?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: It was more like drafted. After Bracken's murder, I received this on my doorstep with a note. And I quote, "Mr. Brown, you now work for me. This cellphone is enabled with GPS and will only function at the northernmost end of Astor Park. Be there every third Monday of the month at 8:00 a.m. To receive your orders." Kate, it's yours.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: And hopefully you can trace LokSat's next call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mnh-mnh. They're gonna know I'm not you.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: We don't have a conversation. The phone rings, I answer. An electronically modified voice gives me instructions. It lasts no more than 60 seconds, so have your best people ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Um -- I'm gonna go to the same places that I always go -- work, home. I'm gonna act as if nothing has changed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but it has. And we can protect you.

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: All I want from you is your promise that you will see this thing through. And remember who I chose to be today because nobody else will. That's a damn fine Scotch, Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is it. It's our one shot at LokSat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And when the time comes, we're gonna make it count.
